result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric T McDaniel Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Interfere w/ Child Custody [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.31(2).
  • Interfere w/ Child Custody [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.31(2).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 8:38 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Eric T McDaniel in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon questioning of the Court, Counsel indicate that they have no factual corrections to PSI  
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel

ON COUNT #1, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 15 MONTHS INITIAL CONFINEMENT AND 15 MONTHS EXTENDED SUPERVISION, CONSECUTIVE TO ANY PREVIOUSLY IMPOSED SENTENCE
ON COUNT #2, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 15 MONTHS INITIAL CONFINEMENT AND 15 MONTHS EXTENDED SUPERVISION, CONSECUTIVE TO CT#1

On Count #5, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release; to commence consecutive to Count #2 

On Count #6, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS
--serve 5 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release; to commence to commence consecutive to Count #5

and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges for therapy, employment, counseling & treatment (Ct#1); to commence forthwith - Sentence may transfer to another county as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or therapy as per Agent
--To attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $536 ($268 each on Counts #1 & #2)
--To pay $500 DNA Surcharge ($250 each on Counts #1 & #2)
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each on Counts #5 & #6)
--To pay $400 ($200 each on Counts #5 & #6)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (Count #1)
--No Contact with any persons under the age of 18 except supervised or incidental contact necessary for daily living, work, and school

If revoked, the Court finds that Mr. McDaniel is eligible for SAP & ERP
If revoked, the Court finds that Mr. McDaniel has 146 days credit for time already served - On Count #1 ONLY

Case called at 10:26 am [Case was scheduled for PLEAS]
Defendant Eric T McDaniel in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1, #2, #5 & #6; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance NOT verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #3 & #4
ADA Hall requests the Court order PSI, will also be request by defense to complete their own investigation, can get victim rights compliance in that time
Court orders PSI & revokes bond

Case called at 3:13 pm
[Judge Jennifer L. Weston presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Eric T McDaniel in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. McDaniel is not a Jr. - requests to amend the complaint
DA Happ: Mr. McDaniel's criminal history is all with a Jr., issues was addressed earlier, no proofs have yet been submitted. Could be that an error was made early on in the history, but do not have supporting information at this time.
Atty Svehlek: Do have offer that are rejecting at this time, requests matter be set for FSSC & JT
Counsel agree 2 days will be needed for trial
DA Happ informs the Court that there are 4 juvenile witnesses and at least 2 law enforcement officer witnesses
Upon further discussion, Counsel agree that matter can be set for a 1 day trial

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 6/10/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 6/16/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Case called at 8:32 am 
[Reserve Judge Daniel Klossner presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Eric T McDaniel in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Officer Brandon Sachse--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by ADA Hall
--cross exam by Atty Svehlek
Evidence Closed; ADA Hall requests bind-over; Argument by Atty Svehlek; Argument by ADA Hall

Court does not find probable cause for Counts #3 & #4 and does not bind over for arraignment.

Preliminary hearing on March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 2:08 pm
Defendant Eric T McDaniel in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted
Defendant informs the Court that he is not a Junior as listed on the criminal complaint.
DA Happ informs the Court that the referral came through as a Junior.
Court will leave th Junior determination to another day.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the address listed on the criminal complaint is correct.
Court and DA Happ dicuss that the criminal complaint is missing some of the charging language.
DA Happ moves to amend the criminal complaint.
recess: 2:15 pm to allow the State to lay out the charging language in Counts #1-#4.
reconvene: 2:36 pm
Court verifies with the Defendant that he has received the Amended Criminal Complaint
Charges and maximum penalties recited from the Amended Criminal Complaint
Court has reviewed the amended criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Counts #1-#6.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation
Reading waived
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No contact with any persons under the age of 18

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit. (requested by the defense)

Recess: 
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 3/28/14 at 8:30 am
